subelement_relations.Description: Load forecasting is a technique used to predict the future electricity demand based on historical data and other relevant factors. It helps in optimizing the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity, leading to more efficient and sustainable energy systems.

Demand-side management refers to the strategies and measures implemented to modify consumer electricity usage patterns. It aims to reduce peak demand, shift load to off-peak periods, and encourage energy efficiency and conservation. By actively managing the demand, it helps in balancing the electricity grid and promoting sustainable energy consumption.
